title: Bug 5340: Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect
description: When attempting to cancel the process of adding an exception breakpoint, the progress dialog closes immediately. Even when the progress dialog closes, the exception list still comes up, ignoring the cancellation request. The expected behavior is for the cancellation request to be honored. Alternatively, when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run, the cancelable parameter should be set to false in order to disable the cancel button.
OB: When attempting to cancel the process of adding an exception breakpoint, the progress dialog closes immediately. Even when the progress dialog closes, the exception list still comes up, ignoring the cancellation request.
EB: The cancellation request should be honored and the progress dialog should not close. If the progress dialog does close, the exception list should not come up.
SR:
1. Open the application and go to the Add Exception Breakpoint feature.
2. Start the process of adding an exception breakpoint.
3. Attempt to cancel the process by clicking the cancel button.
4. Observe that the progress dialog closes immediately and the exception list still comes up.
